title: The hegemony of patriarchal culture in critical eleven and the architecture of love
abstract: This thesis is intended to analyze how patriarchy values are still implemented in Indonesian literature and this thesis will specifically analyze how Raia and Anya from Ika Natassa’s work called Critical Eleven and The Architecture of Love face the problem with patriarchy culture is still affecting their attitude when they face the values. This thesis will be divided into three chapters where the first one will be talking about the theories the writer will be using from 3M (masak, macak, manak) the wife duty to their husband especially in the Java and how these three are formed, second part will be talking about Raia and Anya are affected with these norm values around them with their daily life and last part will be talking about the conclusion how the patriarch values affect both Raia and Anya in their life and how those values are still implemented in the Ika Natassa’s book.
source: A Critical Thesis No. 01012406/ING/2023; Jessica Tamara (11416035)
